meanings.definition: Kamikazes: Japanese pilots who carried out suicide attacks during World War II.
meanings.sent1: The kamikazes bravely sacrificed themselves for their country.
meanings.sent2: The kamikazes flew their planes into enemy ships with determination.
meanings.sent3: The kamikazes were like fearless heroes in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The kamikazes' planes became deadly weapons of honor.
meanings.sent5: The kamikazes' final missions were filled with courage and loyalty.

meanings.definition: Kamikazes: A reckless or daring person who takes extreme risks.
meanings.sent1: The kamikazes of the business world invest all their money in risky ventures.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the kamikazes of the group, always trying dangerous stunts.
meanings.sent3: The kamikazes of the party decided to jump into the pool fully clothed.
meanings.sent4: His decision to quit his job without a backup plan was a kamikazes move.
meanings.sent5: The kamikazes of the mountain climbed without any safety gear, risking it all.
